regulationsummary: The regulation establishes a comprehensive licensing regime for virtual asset VA service providers and representatives, requiring fitandproper assessments, approval of responsible officers and ultimate owners, and strict controls over client assets and premises Licensed entities must maintain a register, keep client assets segregated, and comply with antimoneylaundering and antiterrorist financing policies The Commission may impose, amend or remove conditions on licences, accreditations, and premises, and must provide reasons for decisions and allow review by a tribunal Failure to meet any of these obligations can result in fines, imprisonment, or revocation of licences and approvals

actionablerules.obligation: A corporation must apply for a licence to provide a VA service only if it is a fit and proper person, has at least two approved responsible officers one of whom is an executive director, and has an approved premises for keeping records
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Corporate applicants for VA service licences
risksignalstomonitor: Application from a corporation that is not a company under the Companies Ordinance
Missing or unapproved responsible officers in the application
Premises not approved by the Commission
requireddocumentsorcontrols: List of responsible officers with approval certificates
Premises approval notice from the Commission
Proof of payment of prescribed fee
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the fit and proper assessment must include enhanced due diligence on the corporations directors, ultimate owners, and financial standing

actionablerules.obligation: Every responsible officer of a licensed provider must be approved by the Commission, have sufficient authority within the provider, and be a fit and proper person
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Responsible officers of licensed VA providers
risksignalstomonitor: Unapproved or unfit individuals listed as responsible officers
Responsible officers who are not resident in Hong Kong
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Letter of authority from the provider
Proof of Hong Kong residency eg, address, ID
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the Commission must conduct enhanced due diligence on each responsible officers background, including criminal history and financial integrity

actionablerules.obligation: An ultimate owner of a licensed provider must obtain written approval from the Commission before becoming an ultimate owner and must keep the Commission informed of any changes to their contact details within 7 business days
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Ultimate owners of licensed VA providers
risksignalstomonitor: Unapproved ultimate owners listed in the providers records
Changes to ultimate owner details not reported within 7 days
Ultimate owners with a history of moneylaundering or terrorist financing offences
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written approval notice from the Commission
Updated contact details address, phone, email
Fit and proper assessment for the ultimate owner
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  enhanced due diligence is required on the ultimate owners identity, ownership structure, and criminal record

actionablerules.obligation: Client assets held by a licensed provider or its associated entities must be kept separate from the providers own assets and cannot be used to satisfy any court order or execution against the provider
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed VA providers and their associated entities
risksignalstomonitor: Mixing of client assets with company assets in accounting records
Use of client assets to settle debts or obligations of the provider
Failure to maintain separate custody accounts
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Internal control procedures for client asset segregation
Audit trail of all client asset movements
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the provider must perform enhanced due diligence on the source of client assets and monitor for suspicious transfers

actionablerules.obligation: A licensed provider must keep all records or documents required under the Ordinance only at premises approved by the Commission
risksignalstomonitor: Use of nonapproved premises for record keeping
Inadequate security controls at approved premises
Failure to update the register with approved premises details
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Premises approval notice from the Commission
Security and access control logs for the premises
Regular audit reports on premises compliance
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  enhanced due diligence is required to verify the suitability and security of the approved premises

actionablerules.obligation: A licensed person or ultimate owner must notify the Commission in writing of any change in any information that has been provided to the Commission within 7 business days
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed VA providers and ultimate owners
risksignalstomonitor: Delayed or missing notifications of changes in ownership, contact details, or business address
Inconsistent information between the register and the providers records
Failure to update the register after a change
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notification form with details of the change
Supporting documents eg, updated ID, address proof
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard notification procedures apply, but the Commission may review the change for fit and proper compliance
